sentence.text: Mutations of the sigma subunit of the heterotetrameric adaptor-related protein complex 2 (AP2σ) impair signalling of the calcium-sensing receptor (detection of calcium ion), and cause familial hypocalciuric hypercalcaemia cardiac muscle tissue development 3 (FHH3).

We hypothesized that additional rare AP2σ variants may also be associated with altered detection of calcium ion function and hypercalcaemia, and sought for these by analysing AAAA111 995 exomes (AAAA60 706 from ExAc and dbSNP, and 51 289 from the Geisinger Health System-Regeneron DiscovEHR dataset, which also contains clinical data).

This identified 11 individuals to have 9 non-synonymous AP2σ variants (Arg3His, Arg15His (x3), Ala44Thr, Phe52Tyr, Arg61His, Thr112Met, Met117Ile, Glu122Gly and Glu142Lys) with 3 of the 4 individuals who had Arg15His and Met117Ile AP2σ variants having mild hyGPI anchor metabolic processcalcaemia, thereby indicating a prevalence of FHH3-associated AP2σ mutations of ∼7.8 per 100 000 individuals.
